definitions.definition: (ditransitive) To move, shift, provide something abstract or concrete to someone or something or somewhere.
(ditransitive) To estimate or predict (a duration or probability) for (something).
definitions.example: I give it a 95% chance of success.

definitions.definition: To yield slightly when a force is applied.
To collapse under pressure or force.
definitions.example: One pillar gave, then more, and suddenly the whole floor pancaked onto the floor below.

definitions.definition: To provide, as, a service or a broadcast.
To lead (onto or into).
definitions.example: The master bedroom gives onto a spacious balcony.

definitions.definition: To provide a view of.
To exhibit as a product or result; to produce; to yield.
definitions.example: The number of men, divided by the number of ships, gives four hundred to each ship.

definitions.definition: To cause; to make; used with the infinitive.
To cause (someone) to have; produce in (someone); effectuate.
To allow or admit by way of supposition; to concede.
definitions.example: He can be bad-tempered, I'll give you that, but he's a hard worker.

definitions.definition: To attribute; to assign; to adjudge.
To communicate or announce (advice, tidings, etc.); to pronounce or utter (an opinion, a judgment, a shout, etc.).
definitions.example: The umpire finally gave his decision: the ball was out.

definitions.definition: To grant power or permission to; to allow.
To devote or apply (oneself).
definitions.example: That boy is given to fits of bad temper.

definitions.definition: To become soft or moist.
To shed tears; to weep.
To have a misgiving.
To be going on, to be occurring
The act of bestowing as a gift; a conferring or imparting.
A gift; a benefaction.
The act of softening, breaking, or yielding.
Having the tendency to give; generous
